Description: Body sherd from upper part of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater. Outside, head of female, probably a maenad. to left; above, reserved groove at carination to rim. Inside glazed with narrow reserved band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Attributed by Beazley to the same krater as Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN-1896-1908-G138.46
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (IIIi pl. 50, 23)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1017)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
